intro: Urostachys rosenstockianus, commonly known as the Rosentrockian stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant features fleshy, thick leaves that are typically covered in a waxy cuticle, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink during the summer months. Urostachys rosenstockianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and hardiness.
